folder: Piers and shoreline between Buttermilk Channel and Brooklyn Bridge - [Bush Terminal Building.], Manhattan, NY
title: East River - Piers and shoreline between Buttermilk Channel and Brooklyn Bridge - [Bush Terminal Building.]

text:
(1) Bird's Eye view of Governor's Island, south from 111 John Street, in Manhattan. July 8, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, as seen from the Manhattan end of Brooklyn Bridge. August 22, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same as view 2, at an earlier date. On the left appear Brooklyn piers. The vantage point is the Brooklyn Bridge. July 23, 1925.

P. L. Sperr.
(No. 3 not a dry mount item).
title: Islands - Governor's Island - Bird's Eye View.

text:
Buttermilk Channel, Recreation Pier, at the foot of State Street.
October 1928.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Buttermilk Channel - Recreation Pier - Foot of State Street - Brooklyn.

folder: Hamilton Avenue & Wyckoff Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Hamilton Ave., at Buttermilk Channel, showing tugboats of the Wyle Lighterage Corporation.

June 6, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Buttermilk Channel, southeast from Governors Island, showing the Brooklyn shore and skyline, and south of Hamilton Ave. Note the Grace Lines occupying pier 33 at the extreme left. May 1, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Buttermilk Channel - Governors Island - Brooklyn shore and skyline.

text:
East River, shore and skyline, south of the Brooklyn Bridge, seen at the extreme left. The shore area seen beyond the piers is known as Borough Hall Area.

August 2, 1929

P. L. Sperr
title: East River - Brooklyn.
